urls.title: Margaret Heffernan - Wilful Blindness
urls.description: Why We Ignore the Obvious at our Peril. Heffernan argues that the biggest threats and dangers we face are the ones we don't see - not because they're secret or invisible, but because we're willfully blind.

urls.title: Canada's 'tenuous hold' in Arctic could be challenged by Russia, China, says top soldier | CBC News
urls.description: Canada‚Äôs hold on the outer reaches of its Arctic territory is ‚Äútenuous‚Äù and will face significant challenges from both Russia and China in the future, the country‚Äôs top military commander warned a parliamentary committee on Tuesday.

text: .@Murray_Brewster The @CanadianForces displays https://t.co/Iocxoi3bd4 in https://t.co/d9W22ppYm0 vis a vis #uspoli's @POTUS hasn't historically respected #cdnpoli control of the NW Passage, despite cooperating with #Canada to build radars where I once lived in #cambridgebay #nu https://t.co/bInGPtWXhL

@nspector4 ‚ÄúThe General emphasized he saw no present threat to Canadian territory‚Äù The biggest challenge in our Arctic is a lack of economic & food security for its people. The biggest political threat to our sovereignty is that the USA doesn‚Äôt recognize the Northwest passage as üá®üá¶.

@thehill @TheHillOpinion Canada is in danger of losing sovereignty over ‚Äúour‚Äù Arctic if we do not build bases and a military presence. We cannot rely on the US to protect Canadian interests, as the US does not recognize the NW Passage as being in Canadian territory. @RoyalCanNavy needs ice capable ships

Reminder: not all NATO countries agree that the Northwest Passage is within Canadian territory. Unless Canada acts to secure the passage, a huge chunk of ‚Äúour‚Äù Arctic will belong to whoever exploits it. @RoyalCanNavy https://t.co/zzYCJPrcrX

@GrayConnolly On that note, the fact that Canada doesnt have the ability to maintain a year round naval presence in the Arctic to patrol the NW passage I think is demonstrative of our country's lack of seriousness.

@liberal_party Why not invest in protecting the Arctic Ocean from foreign powers?  Not every country recognizes Canada‚Äôs claim to the NW Passage. We require 365/24/7 @RoyalCanNavy presence. And nuke powered subs!

@NATOCanada @NATO And Canada needs to INCREASE defense spending to 2% GDP and needs to take Arctic security more seriously. We need to update the DEW system, think about policing the NW Passage, and having nuclear powered submarines capable of 24/7/364 patrols of the Arctic.

I am writing my LLM thesis on UNCLOS and the üá®üá¶ Arctic, and I was wondering if anyone knows where one can find a current nautical chart of the Northwest Passage? #askingforafriend #ArcticSecurity

https://t.co/zJkzuF8qR5

Canada started long road(waterway) back to prioritizing our claim to the Northwest passage.   

This can open new lucrative opportunities for Canada, while reducing green house gas emissions from fleets that sail via Panama Canal

And how will Canada defend our interests in the Arctic? China wants the Northwest Passage, the energy stores and the rare earth minerals that are there. @CanadianForces @RoyalCanNavy https://t.co/kUyBLHnqcG

Fitting that Irving gives venerable Acadia its latest TLC: bought by Canada to serve our Arctic sovereignty and put to work in Hudson Bay in 1913, Irving built  ships like HMCS Harry DeWolf today in the Northwest Passage or Atlantic Elm at Baker Lake serve this enduring need https://t.co/yNCtnHNI3T

I can‚Äôt think of a single reason to send a bulk carrier to Antarctica. But I can certainly think of reasons to use the Northwest Passage through Canada‚Äôs Arctic. Is @RoyalCanNavy ready and able to defend such challenges to our sovereignty? @MichaelChongMP https://t.co/Jv8idE99JL

it‚Äôs a big ship with amazing capability should Mona Passage freeze over. Until then, the ship is capable of SAR, operational missions, confidence building with friends and humanitarian aid even. The Canadian history of sailing these waters is ironically greater than the Arctic https://t.co/txrEWF6tLN https://t.co/mqLonhNbCb

@adrianromanelli @jonchwalker78 @davidfrum @TheAtlantic I draw the line at the Arctic Circle, its  rough Passage but well get through it. And of course me, being Canadian, an Iniukshuk will guide.
Happy Easter.

urls.title: Top defence official says China is a threat to Canadian Arctic
urls.description: Deputy minister Jody Thomas said Beijing is turning its attention to Canada‚Äôs Northwest Passage as melting ice opens up Arctic sea lanes to shipping and resource exploitation, including fish, petroleum and critical minerals
